content.description: This problem follows up the center face. Follow good crystals and good smearing to top out. Both of these problems the center an the right variation are worth doing!
content.location: South Face of boulder facing half dome.

content.description: There are two slab problems on the backside of the Fort. Both are surprisingly fun and are worth doing despite what they look like walking by. Both are about the same grade. Follow small crystals up using good smearing to the top.
content.location: south face of the boulder. Side facing Half Dome

content.description: Classic warm up on the Fort and for the area. Sit Start on the lowest jugs. Move up the huge jug like features which is fun and sort of pumpy. These Jugs literally Jut out of the arête. Really cool and unique. Top part is kind of a bear hug on small crimpers

The Fort is quite a large block with a nice overhang on its northface and plenty of warm ups to keep a group busy for a bit. The Fort gets its name because back in the 90s logs used to be perched up against the northface creating a fort. Rumor has it Bob Archabold camped here a bit.
